user_story: As Agile Alex, I want to create a new project and define its timeline using 2-week sprints, so that I can accurately plan project duration and resource needs from the outset.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am logged in as Agile Alex
When I navigate to the 'Projects' section and click 'Create New Project'
And I enter 'Project Alpha', start date '2023-01-01', and end date '2023-06-30'
Then the system should automatically calculate and display the total number of 2-week sprints (e.g., 13 sprints)
And I should be able to confirm the project creation.

user_story: As Agile Alex, I want to add an existing employee to my project with their specific role, LCAT, and total funded hours, so that I can clearly define the scope of work and budget for each team member on the project.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am managing 'Project Alpha'
When I select 'Add Employee' and choose 'John Doe' from the centralized employee pool
And I specify 'Developer' as his role, 'Senior Developer' as his LCAT, and '880' as his total funded hours for Project Alpha
Then John Doe should appear in the project's allocation grid with his details
And the system should track his remaining funded hours for Project Alpha.

user_story: As Agile Alex, I want to allocate hours for an employee across different months/sprints within a project, so that I can precisely plan their workload and instantly see their full-time equivalent (FTE) percentage.
acceptance_criteria: Given John Doe is assigned to 'Project Alpha' with 880 funded hours
And the system has calculated 168 standard full-time hours for January
When I input '160' hours for John Doe in the January column of the allocation grid
Then the system should automatically display '95.24%' as his FTE for January
And his remaining funded hours for Project Alpha should update to '720'.

user_story: As Agile Alex, I want to be immediately warned if I try to over-allocate an employee beyond their monthly capacity across all projects, so that I can prevent burnout and scheduling conflicts.
acceptance_criteria: Given John Doe is allocated 80 hours to 'Project Alpha' in February
And John Doe is also allocated 100 hours to 'Project Beta' in February
And the standard monthly full-time hours for February are 160
When I attempt to allocate an additional 10 hours to John Doe for 'Project Gamma' in February
Then the system should display a visual warning (e.g., red highlight) and a message indicating John Doe would be over-allocated (190/160 hours)
And the system should prevent me from saving the allocation without explicit override.

user_story: As Compliance Chris, I want to ensure that hour allocations for an employee on a project do not exceed their total funded hours for that specific project, so that I can maintain budget compliance and accurate billing.
acceptance_criteria: Given John Doe is assigned to 'Project Alpha' with a total of 880 funded hours
And John Doe has already been allocated 870 hours across previous months for Project Alpha
When I attempt to allocate '20' hours for John Doe in the current month for Project Alpha
Then the system should display a warning that the allocation exceeds the remaining funded hours (10 hours remaining, 20 requested)
And the system should prevent me from saving the allocation without explicit override.

user_story: As Agile Alex, I want to record an employee's planned time-off (e.g., vacation), so that their monthly capacity is accurately adjusted, leading to more realistic allocation planning.
acceptance_criteria: Given the standard full-time hours for July are 176
When I navigate to John Doe's profile and add a vacation from 'July 15th' to 'July 19th' (5 working days)
Then the system should automatically reduce John Doe's available full-time hours for July (e.g., 176 - 40 = 136 hours)
And this adjusted capacity should be reflected in the allocation grid for July for all projects he is assigned to.

user_story: As Agile Alex, I want the AI agent to suggest optimal hour distributions for my project team, so that I can quickly get data-driven recommendations to efficiently staff my project based on skills, availability, and project phases.
acceptance_criteria: Given I have defined project phases and assigned employees with skills to 'Project Alpha'
When I click 'Get AI Allocation Suggestions' for Project Alpha
Then the system should present a proposed allocation of hours for each employee across sprints/months
And the suggestions should consider employee skills, availability, and current workload.

user_story: As Agile Alex, I want to review potential over-allocation conflicts identified by the AI agent, so that I can proactively address staffing issues before they impact project delivery or team morale.
acceptance_criteria: Given John Doe is currently over-allocated by 20 hours in October across 'Project Alpha' and 'Project Beta'
When I view the 'Conflicts' section or receive an in-app notification
Then the system should clearly highlight John Doe's over-allocation for October
And the system should suggest potential resolutions, such as 'Reduce Project Alpha allocation by 20 hours' or 'Propose alternative employee for Project Beta'.

user_story: As Agile Alex, I want to ask a natural language question about an employee's allocation, so that I can quickly retrieve specific information without manually searching through reports or grids.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am on the StaffAlloc dashboard
When I type 'How many hours does John Doe have left on Project Alpha?' into the chat interface
Then the system should respond with the current remaining funded hours for John Doe on Project Alpha.

user_story: As Strategic Sarah, I want to ask a natural language question about resource availability by role/LCAT, so that I can quickly identify potential candidates for new projects or to fill gaps.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am on the StaffAlloc dashboard
When I type 'Who is available for 50% FTE in March with a 'Developer' LCAT?' into the chat interface
Then the system should list all employees matching the criteria, along with their current March allocations and remaining capacity.

user_story: As Strategic Sarah, I want to view a high-level dashboard of all projects and their aggregated staffing data, so that I can gain a holistic understanding of departmental capacity, utilization, and potential risks across the entire portfolio.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am logged in as Strategic Sarah
When I navigate to the 'Organizational Roll-up Dashboard'
Then I should see aggregated data for total allocated hours, remaining funded hours, and overall resource utilization by role/LCAT across all active projects
And I should see visual indicators for potential cross-project over/under-allocations at a glance.

user_story: As Agile Alex, I want to view a consolidated dashboard for a specific employee, so that I can understand their total workload across all assigned projects and identify potential over-allocation or under-utilization.
acceptance_criteria: Given John Doe is assigned to 'Project Alpha' and 'Project Beta'
When I navigate to John Doe's 'Employee Utilization Dashboard'
Then I should see a month-by-month breakdown of his allocated hours and FTE percentages for each project
And I should see his total combined FTE percentage for each month, with visual warnings for over 100% allocation.

user_story: As Compliance Chris, I want to generate a report summarizing resource allocation by Role and LCAT across all projects, so that I can enable strategic resource planning, identify skill gaps, and ensure compliance with contractual LCAT requirements.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am logged in as Compliance Chris
When I navigate to 'Reports' and select 'Role/LCAT Breakdown' for the current quarter
Then the system should display a report showing total allocated hours and FTEs for each Role and LCAT across all projects
And I should be able to filter this report by department or specific projects.

user_story: As Agile Alex, I want to input and adjust hours in a familiar spreadsheet-like grid, so that I can quickly and intuitively manage allocations while receiving instant feedback on validity and FTE calculations.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am on the project's 'Hours Allocation' screen
When I click into a cell to enter hours for an employee in a specific month
Then the interface should behave like a spreadsheet, allowing easy navigation and data entry
And as I enter hours, the corresponding FTE percentage and allocation status (e.g., color-coding) should update in real-time.

user_story: As Compliance Chris, I want to define and manage a master list of Roles and LCATs for the organization, so that I can ensure standardized terminology and accurate classification of resources for billing and reporting.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am logged in as Compliance Chris with appropriate permissions
When I navigate to 'System Configuration' and select 'Roles & LCATs'
Then I should see a list of existing Roles and LCATs
And I should be able to add a new Role (e.g., 'DevOps Engineer') and a new LCAT (e.g., 'Principal Software Engineer')
And these new entries should be available for selection when creating employee profiles or assigning to projects.

user_story: As Strategic Sarah, I want the AI agent to analyze and suggest adjustments for workload balancing across the department, so that I can prevent employee burnout, maximize productivity, and ensure equitable distribution of tasks.
acceptance_criteria: Given there are employees with significantly different FTE allocations across the department for the upcoming quarter
When I activate the 'Smart Workload Balancing' feature from the Organizational Dashboard
Then the AI agent should identify employees with high and low utilization
And it should suggest specific re-allocations or shifts in project assignments to balance workloads more evenly, considering skills and project needs.

user_story: As Strategic Sarah, I want to view AI-generated predictions for future resource shortages or surpluses, so that I can proactively plan for hiring, training, or re-assignment to meet future demand or optimize existing capacity.
acceptance_criteria: Given current project pipeline and employee availability data
When I access the 'Predictive Resource Insights' dashboard
Then the system should display a forecast indicating potential shortages (e.g., 'Need 2 more Senior Developers in Q3') or surpluses (e.g., '1 Junior QA Engineer available 50% in Q4') by Role/LCAT
And these predictions should be based on projected project needs and current resource allocations.

user_story: As Agile Alex, I want to update the status of my project and archive it upon completion, so that I can maintain an accurate portfolio overview and retain historical data without cluttering active views.
acceptance_criteria: Given 'Project Alpha' is currently 'In Progress'
When I change its status to 'Completed' and then select 'Archive Project'
Then 'Project Alpha' should no longer appear in my active project list
And I should still be able to access its historical data and reports from an 'Archived Projects' view.

user_story: As Compliance Chris, I want to manage the global holiday calendar, so that I can ensure accurate calculation of monthly full-time hours for all employees, impacting allocation capacity.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am logged in as Compliance Chris with Administrator privileges
When I navigate to 'System Configuration' and select 'Holiday Calendar'
Then I should see a list of configured holidays for the year
And I should be able to add a new holiday (e.g., 'Company Picnic Day' on '2024-08-15')
And this new holiday should automatically reduce the calculated full-time hours for August for all employees.

user_story: As Agile Alex, I want the AI agent to recommend employees with specific skills for a new project role, so that I can quickly identify the best-fit internal resources based on their expertise, availability, and current workload.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am staffing a new 'Cybersecurity Analyst' role for 'Project Gamma'
When I specify required skills (e.g., 'Penetration Testing', 'AWS Security') and desired FTE (e.g., 100%)
Then the AI agent should recommend employees from the central pool who possess those skills, are available, and have capacity
And the recommendations should be ranked by suitability, showing their current workload.
